description: PONTIAC, Mich. — Jennifer Crumbley said her teenage son, Ethan, was worried about his future and would get stressed out, but his mental health never alarmed her enough that she felt he needed to see a professional.
title: Jennifer Crumbley, mother of Michigan shooter, takes stand at involuntary manslaughter trial

description: A graphic video from a Pennsylvania man accused of killing his father that circulated for hours on YouTube has put a spotlight yet again on gaps in social media companies’ ability to prevent horrific postings from spreading across the web.
title: Video of beheaded dad stayed on YouTube for hours, raising questions about why it wasn’t taken down sooner

description: The Houthis have sparked alarm with drone attacks in the Red Sea, but their use of drone attacks is just the latest iteration of their larger drone strategy.
title: How Yemen’s Houthi rebels have leveraged cheap drones into military success for years

description: Even before Universal Music Group removed its catalog from TikTok in the early hours of Thursday, artists with the label were on the platform sounding the alarm.
title: Artists worry Universal Music Group removing songs could foreshadow trouble

description: Larry David apologizes to Elmo after grabbing his face live on TODAY. "I'm really sorry," he says.
title: Why Larry David is apologizing to Elmo

description: Sharon Winkler, whose son died by suicide as a result of cyberbullying on social media, attended the Senate Judiciary Committee hearing on child safety, but says enough hearings on social media harm have been held and it’s now time for Congress to enact protective laws.
title: 'Very disappointed': Victim's mom calls for action after social media hearing

description: FBI director Christopher Wray is sounding a new alarm about Chinese cyberattacks saying they pose a serious national security threat and are preparing to wreak havoc against U.S. electrical grids and other infrastructure.
title: FBI director: US cannot ‘sleep’ on Chinese cyberattack danger

description: CEOs from five of the biggest social media platforms converged on Capitol Hill for a hearing over online child safety where Meta’s Mark Zuckerberg issued a rare apology to the parents who say their children were victimized. NBC’s Kate Snow reports for TODAY.
title: Mark Zuckerberg apologizes to parents at Capitol Hill hearing

description: Palestinians documented, buried and searched through bags of bodies in the hopes of finding missing loved ones after Israel handed over corpses in southern Gaza this week.
title: Israel returns dozens of Palestinians' bodies to Gaza, prompting a desperate graveside search

description: The leaders of the 27 European Union countries sealed a deal Thursday to provide Ukraine with a new 50-billion-euro ($54 billion) support package for its war-ravaged economy despite weeks of threats from Hungary to veto the move.
title: E.U. agrees on a new $54B aid package for Ukraine despite Hungary's veto threat

description: Former President Donald Trump’s affiliated committees spent about $27 million on lawyers’ bills and related legal fees in the last six months of 2023.
title: More than $27M in Trump campaign fundraising went to legal costs in the last six months of 2023

description: Music from artists Drake, Rihanna and Taylor Swift may be removed from TikTok after Universal Music Group accused the app of "intimidating" and "bullying" them in contract negotiations.
title: Universal Music Group threatens to pull songs from top artists on TikTok
